title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement artjom31415@googlemail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Introduction to 'ggsignif' package
text: Research hypotheses often concern differences two multiple groups significance-based hypothesis testing can provide indices evidence differences. Naturally, people visualizing group differences, might also wish quickly annotate difference two levels group plot significantly different (look questions). package exactly ! provides single layer geom_signif can calculate significance difference groups add annotation plot single line. , extends fundamental strength ggplot, allows one quickly make advanced plots combining layers visualization, can encapsulate complex statistical methods (geom_smooth, geom_contour etc.).

title: Introduction to 'ggsignif' package
text: First step: load needed packages. Second step: plot data.  ’s , simple ! Note , statistically analyze data, run one-way ANOVA assess group means differ follow post hoc multiple comparisons fine-grained comparisons different levels group. ggsignif package provides way graphically display (depending research hypotheses context) comparisons.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggsignif) ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_boxplot() + # using `ggsignif` to display comparison of interest   geom_signif(     comparisons = list(c("versicolor", "virginica")),     map_signif_level = TRUE   )

title: Introduction to 'ggsignif' package
text: Sometimes one might need advanced control display. example, instead one-way ANOVA design, can complex multiway-ANOVA design. instances, may wish much finer control comparisons include pairwise comparison displays. specify exactly bracket drawn use y_position, xmin xmax parameters combined custom annotations. always necessary geom_signif combined another layer uses position="dodge", changes location visual elements without updating data.  detailed documentation available parameters see manual page geom_signif function: https://const-ae.github.io/ggsignif/reference/stat_signif.html
code: dat <- data.frame(   Group = c("S1", "S1", "S2", "S2"),   Sub = c("A", "B", "A", "B"),   Value = c(3, 5, 7, 8) )  ggplot(dat, aes(Group, Value)) +   geom_bar(aes(fill = Sub), stat = "identity", position = "dodge", width = .5) +   geom_signif(     y_position = c(5.3, 8.3), xmin = c(0.8, 1.8), xmax = c(1.2, 2.2),     annotation = c("**", "NS"), tip_length = 0   ) +   geom_signif(     comparisons = list(c("S1", "S2")),     y_position = 9.3, tip_length = 0, vjust = 0.2   ) +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("grey80", "grey20"))

title: Introduction to 'ggsignif' package
text: problems package, just file issue https://github.com/const-ae/ggsignif.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Constantin Ahlmann-Eltze. Author, maintainer, contributor.            @const_ae Indrajeet Patil. Author, contributor.            @patilindrajeets

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ahlmann-Eltze, C., & Patil, . (2021). ggsignif: R Package Displaying Significance Brackets 'ggplot2'. PsyArxiv. doi:10.31234/osf.io/7awm6
code: @Article{,   title = {{ggsignif}: R Package for Displaying Significance Brackets for {'ggplot2'}},   author = {Ahlmann-Eltze Constantin and Indrajeet Patil},   year = {2021},   journal = {PsyArxiv},   url = {https://psyarxiv.com/7awm6},   doi = {10.31234/osf.io/7awm6}, }

title: Significance Brackets for ggplot2
text: package provides easy way indicate two groups significantly different. Commonly shown bar top connecting groups interest annotated level significance (NS, *, **, ***). package provides single layer (geom_signif) takes groups comparison test (t.test, wilcox etc.) adds annotation plot.

title: Significance Brackets for ggplot2
text: wish cite package publication, can run following command R console:
code: citation("ggsignif") #>  #> To cite 'ggsignif' in publications use: #>  #>   Ahlmann-Eltze, C., & Patil, I. (2021). ggsignif: R Package for #>   Displaying Significance Brackets for 'ggplot2'. PsyArxiv. #>   doi:10.31234/osf.io/7awm6 #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Article{, #>     title = {{ggsignif}: R Package for Displaying Significance Brackets for {'ggplot2'}}, #>     author = {Ahlmann-Eltze Constantin and Indrajeet Patil}, #>     year = {2021}, #>     journal = {PsyArxiv}, #>     url = {https://psyarxiv.com/7awm6}, #>     doi = {10.31234/osf.io/7awm6}, #>   }

title: Significance Brackets for ggplot2
text: can first install package CRAN: get latest development version: Plot significance  Control direction (either x y) via orientation  Compatible coord_flip  Setting precise location important use position="dodge", case calculate correct position bars automatically.  Advanced Example Sometimes one needs fine tuned ability set location significance bars combination facet_wrap facet_grid. cases can set flag manual=TRUE provide annotations data.frame:  can ignore warning missing aesthetics. details, see: https://const-ae.github.io/ggsignif/articles/intro.html
code: install.packages("ggsignif") install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("const-ae/ggsignif") library(ggplot2) library(ggsignif)  p1 <- ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy)) +   geom_boxplot() +   geom_signif(     comparisons = list(c("compact", "midsize"), c("minivan", "suv")),     map_signif_level = TRUE, textsize = 6   ) +   ylim(NA, 48) p1 p2 <- ggplot(   data = mpg,   mapping = aes(     x = hwy,     y = class   ) ) +   geom_boxplot(     orientation = "y"   ) +   geom_signif(     comparisons = list(       c("compact", "midsize"),       c("minivan", "suv")     ),     map_signif_level = TRUE,     textsize = 6,     margin_top = 0.08,     step_increase = 0.05,     tip_length = 0.01,     orientation = "y"   ) p2 p1 + coord_flip() # Calculate annotation anno <- t.test(   iris[iris$Petal.Width > 1 & iris$Species == "versicolor", "Sepal.Width"],   iris[iris$Species == "virginica", "Sepal.Width"] )$p.value  # Make plot with custom x and y position of the bracket ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Width, fill = Petal.Width > 1)) +   geom_boxplot(position = "dodge") +   geom_signif(     annotation = formatC(anno, digits = 1),     y_position = 4.05, xmin = 2.2, xmax = 3,     tip_length = c(0.2, 0.04)   ) annotation_df <- data.frame(   color = c("E", "H"),   start = c("Good", "Fair"),   end = c("Very Good", "Good"),   y = c(3.6, 4.7),   label = c("Comp. 1", "Comp. 2") )  annotation_df #>   color start       end   y   label #> 1     E  Good Very Good 3.6 Comp. 1 #> 2     H  Fair      Good 4.7 Comp. 2  ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = cut, y = carat)) +   geom_boxplot() +   geom_signif(     data = annotation_df,     aes(xmin = start, xmax = end, annotations = label, y_position = y),     textsize = 3, vjust = -0.2,     manual = TRUE   ) +   facet_wrap(~color) +   ylim(NA, 5.3)

title: Significance Brackets for ggplot2
text: package provided currently don’t plans capacity add new features . nonetheless feature like see package, always welcome submit pull request, try address soon possible.

title: Significance Brackets for ggplot2
text: Please note ggsignif project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: ggsignif: Significance Brackets for 'ggplot2' — ggsignif-package
text: Enrich 'ggplots' group-wise comparisons. package provides easy way indicate two groups significantly different. Commonly shown bracket top connecting groups interest annotated level significance (NS, *, **, ***). package provides single layer (geom_signif()) takes groups comparison test (t.test(), wilcox.text() etc.) arguments adds annotation plot.

title: ggsignif: Significance Brackets for 'ggplot2' — ggsignif-package
text: Maintainer: Constantin Ahlmann-Eltze artjom31415@googlemail.com (ORCID) (@const_ae) [contributor] Authors: Indrajeet Patil patilindrajeet.science@gmail.com (ORCID) (@patilindrajeets) [contributor]

title: Create significance layer — stat_signif
text: Create significance layer

title: Create significance layer — stat_signif
code: stat_signif(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   test.args = NULL,   annotations = NULL,   map_signif_level = FALSE,   y_position = NULL,   xmin = NULL,   xmax = NULL,   margin_top = 0.05,   step_increase = 0,   tip_length = 0.03,   size = 0.5,   textsize = 3.88,   family = "",   vjust = 0,   parse = FALSE,   manual = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   ... )  geom_signif(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "signif",   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   comparisons = NULL,   test = "wilcox.test",   test.args = NULL,   annotations = NULL,   map_signif_level = FALSE,   y_position = NULL,   xmin = NULL,   xmax = NULL,   margin_top = 0.05,   step_increase = 0,   extend_line = 0,   tip_length = 0.03,   size = 0.5,   textsize = 3.88,   family = "",   vjust = 0,   parse = FALSE,   manual = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   ... )

title: Create significance layer — stat_signif
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. na.rm FALSE (default), removes missing values warning.  TRUE silently removes missing values. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). comparisons list length-2 vectors. entries vector either names 2 values x-axis 2 integers correspond index columns interest. test name statistical test applied values 2 columns (e.g. t.test, wilcox.test etc.). implement custom test make sure returns list entry called p.value. test.args additional arguments test method annotations character vector alternative annotations, null test ignored map_signif_level Boolean value, p-value directly written annotation asterisks used instead. Alternatively one can provide named numeric vector create custom mappings p-values annotation: example: c("***"=0.001, "**"=0.01, "*"=0.05). Alternatively, one can provide function takes numeric argument (p-value) returns string. y_position numeric vector y positions brackets xmin, xmax numeric vector positions left right sides brackets, respectively margin_top numeric vector much higher maximum value bars start fraction total height step_increase numeric vector increase fraction total height every additional comparison minimize overlap. tip_length numeric vector fraction total height bar goes indicate precise column size change width lines bracket textsize change size text family change font used text vjust move text relative bracket parse TRUE, labels parsed expressions displayed described ?plotmath. manual Boolean flag indicates parameters provided data.frame. option necessary one wants plot different annotations per facet. orientation orientation layer. default (‘NA’) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting 'orientation' either "x" "y" ... arguments passed layer. often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like color = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. extend_line Numeric allows shorten (negative values) extend (positive value) horizontal line groups comparison; defaults 0.

title: Create significance layer — stat_signif
code: if (FALSE) { library(ggplot2) library(ggsignif)  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy)) +   geom_boxplot() +   geom_signif(comparisons = list(     c("compact", "pickup"),     c("subcompact", "suv")   ))  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy)) +   geom_boxplot() +   geom_signif(     comparisons = list(       c("compact", "pickup"),       c("subcompact", "suv")     ),     map_signif_level = function(p) sprintf("p = %.2g", p)   )  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy)) +   geom_boxplot() +   geom_signif(     annotations = c("First", "Second"),     y_position = c(30, 40), xmin = c(4, 1), xmax = c(5, 3)   ) }

title: Version 0.6.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-13 Gets rid NOTE CRAN checks.

title: Version 0.6.3
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-09 Introducing orientation argument control direction (either x y) layer better compatible coord_flip(). (@xiangpin, #104)

title: Version 0.6.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-14 Updates visual regression tests vdiffr 1.0.0 release. Removes NOTE lazyData CRAN’s daily checks.

title: Version 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-23 @IndrajeetPatil now ggsignif author recognition significant sustained contributions. Add extend_line parameter make brackets shorter wider (#70). Thanks @romanhaa making PR. Adds new package website: https://const-ae.github.io/ggsignif/. Minimum ggplot2 version needed bumped 3.3.3. Minor internal refactoring Adds snapshot visual regression testing infrastructure.

title: Version 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-08 Support plotmath expression add new parameter parse function. Fixes issue #64. Thanks @IndrajeetPatil idea.

title: Version 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-20 Fix typos README.md (thanks @SMargell) map_signif_level can now take user-supplied function format p-value (PR #52, thanks @ilia-kats)

title: Version 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-08-03 Fix bug stopped textsize working Add manual=TRUE mode, allows parameters given data.frame

title: Version 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-25 Simplify setting brackets custom locations xmin, xmax y_position Extend documentation Bug fixes

title: Version 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-04-26 Fixed bug, alpha() another package loaded (issue #2) Added additional parameters customize bracket linetype, textsize, size (issue #5) Fixed bug annotation identical different brackets (issue #6) Fixed bug multiple comparisons referenced block (issue #8)

title: Version 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-04-05 Initial release CRAN: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ggsignif
